maintenance-item.para: The train VHF radio antenna unit allows the carborne radio VHF unit and wayside equipment to transmit radio signals.

The unit is a low profile antenna attached to the roof shroud of the C Car, at the B-end. (See Figure .) The antenna unit weighs 6 lb and measures approximately 25.0 in. long, 2.2 in. thick, and 4.0 in. high.

A coaxial cable connects the antenna to the radio, located in the locker LC, at the F-end of the car. The coaxial cable plug RADAP connects to the type N, female connector on the underside of the antenna, through the car roof. A Silicone sealant provide a watertight joint between the antenna underside and the roof surface. The roof surface underneath the antenna provides the grounding pad for the antenna.
